Description:
Prime Location White Hills
Located in a quiet street overlooking the Botanical Gardens and close to shops, schools and sporting facilities this weatherboard Victorian style home is a real gem.
The home features high ceilings, dado boards, polished floorboards and ducted heating and cooling throughout.
Accommodation comprises 4 Bedrooms, 2 Bathrooms, well appointed Kitchen and spacious Living areas.
Outside improvements include double carport, garden shed, workshop and outdoor entertaining area.
This is a great property in a great location with the benefits of a pool, gardens and playgrounds right at your doorstep.
Leonie Butler : 0417 521 661

Description:
Victorian Gem on Huge Block
Situated only a short stroll from the Botanical Gardens and White Hills shopping precinct is this Double-Fronted 3-bed Victorian that oozes both period class and functionality.
High ceilings, timber veranda and cast-iron lacework compliment the modern bathroom and laundry and Open Plan Design.
The huge rear yard is perfect for those wanting space and the enormous 40ft x 20ft shed with power and concrete floor and fitted with toilet and a bar is sure to suit a multitude of purposes whether work, rest or play.
Ensuite off master is in keeping with modern feel and storage space in the Attic, with access via staircase provides great use of space!
House Restumped only 4 years ago. Potential to develop STCA.
Dont miss this opportunity!
Marc Cox : 0419 915 273
Insights: 64 Raglan Street, WHITE HILLS VIC 3550 was last sold in 2012 and 40 other 3 bedroom house in WHITE HILLS have recently been sold.

Description:
A Hidden Treasure
This three bedroom WB home set on 690m2 allotment is full of surprises.
The home features two genuine living areas, fully renovated bathroom and kitchen which includes wall oven, DW and plenty of cupboards and bench space.
The outside continues to impress with a new pool, various outdoor undercover areas including a quaint gazebo and to add the wow factor there is a double garage and outside room perfect for a gym/sleepout.
All this located within the Lake Weeroona precinct and walking tracks.
This is definitely a must-see treasure!
Amanda Ellis : 0407 105 283

Description:
Affordable Two Bedroom Unit
Positioned at the front of a quiet four unit complex is this bright and tidy two bedroom unit perfect for investors, first home or those looking for a low maintenance Bendigo base.
Featuring two good sized bedrooms, open plan living and meals with gas heater and spilt system heating and cooling, kitchen with gas cooking and
built in cupboards, combined bathroom and laundry with shower over bath, toilet, stainless steel trough, vanity and washing machine taps.
Externally there is a low maintenance yard with clothesline and vegie patch plus a carport and car space to allow plenty of room for off street parking.
Currently leased to an excellent tenant on a periodic tenancy and located within a quiet pocket of White Hills, close to local shops, primary schools, Weeroona College and only a short drive the Lake Weeroona and the heart of Bendigo.
Jacqueline Kelly : 0400 775 809

Description:
The House Is Larger Than It Seems- Nothing Left To Do - Sited On 688sqm
This beautifully presented home is a real winner.
It offers wonderful Street appeal, pretty garden nooks, privacy for entertaining and a separate driveway where there is room to park a boat and drive through access to garage or workshop with a separate light filled studio attached (total size 30 x 17 ft). The design of the home boasts main bedroom with ensuite, 2 childrens bedrooms with robes, roomy home office or 4th bedroom, formal lounge-dining room with gas log fire as well as kitchen-meals-living with an abundance of cupboards and pretty garden views.
Bonuses include central heating and cooling, 9 foot ceilings, dishwasher, direct internal entry form the double garage, 2 outside entertaining areas and handy access to the walking track to Lake Weeroona. This home offers a totally co-ordinated look, you will be impressed!
Kaye Lazenby : 0407 843 167

Description:
Capitalise on a solid investment - walking distance to Botanic Gardens
A typically solid 'cream-bricker', this home also has extra appeal. Wide corner windows in the large, gas-heated loungeroom frame views of the landscaped front garden. The meals area & kitchen has an electric side-by-side stove amongst an abundance of original cabinetry. Serviced by a neat three-piece bathroom and separate toilet, all three bedrooms can accommodate queen-sized beds, all have ceiling fans and two have built-in robes. Evaporative cooling is ducted throughout. Beneath the nine-foot ceilings, floorboards can be repolished to add a fine finish. Replastering the laundry, installing a trough, replacing some skirting-boards and tiling the bathroom will complete this very inviting home. In the well-fenced backyard, there is plenty of space to extend if desired. Drive through the single carport to a garage plus workshop that has concrete floor and power. Set in a lovely area with the Botanic Gardens at the end of the street, it is right around the corner from shops and a primary school, plus just a few doors away from a pre-school. Home, sweet home!
Nekti Tzouroutis : 0412 242 321

Description:
Affordable Two Bedroom Unit
Positioned at the front of a quiet four unit complex is this bright and tidy two bedroom unit perfect for investors, first home or those looking for a low maintenance Bendigo base.
Featuring two good sized bedrooms, open plan living and meals with gas heater and spilt system heating and cooling, kitchen with gas cooking and
built in cupboards, combined bathroom and laundry with shower over bath, toilet, stainless steel trough, vanity and washing machine taps.
Externally there is a low maintenance yard with clothesline and vegie patch plus a carport and car space to allow plenty of room for off street parking.
Currently leased to an excellent tenant on a periodic tenancy and located within a quiet pocket of White Hills, close to local shops, primary schools, Weeroona College and only a short drive the Lake Weeroona and the heart of Bendigo.

Description:
EXECUTIVE TWO STOREY RETREAT
This superbly maintained home is perfectly situated in the Peppercorns Estate. Backing onto the White Hills oval and the Bendigo walking track, the Peppercorns Estate is virtually surrounded by luscious bushland and yet just a few kilometres from Bendigo.
The home is only six years old and designed to enable the whole family to enjoy its cheerful and light filled spaces. The two childrenâ??s bedrooms downstairs have built in wardrobes and are adjacent to the well appointed, three piece bathroom and separate toilet. Past the bedrooms, the house opens up to the designer kitchen, dining room and sitting room, and large living area. The kitchen has quality Miele appliances which include a stainless steel gas stove top and electric oven and dishwasher. There is a large pantry and careful attention has been paid to the cabinetry which features unique glass cupboard doors.
Upstairs there is a luxurious master bedroom that you can retreat to after a hard dayâ??s work. Here youâ??ll find a spacious, his and hers, walk in wardrobe, a lovely big bathroom with a double shower and double vanity unit and a separate toilet.
At just over 700 squares the block is a good size and the garden which is paved and planted out, extremely low maintenance.
The other features of this home include ducted heating and evaporative cooling throughout and quality floor coverings and tiles. This home is definitely worth an inspection so please call Sally Sheahan on (03) 5445 0044.
Property Code: 1183

Description:
When only quality will do!
You can just tell when a home has been built without short-cuts. This three-bedroom home, on an elevated and beautifully landscaped site, has been built with exacting standards and an eye for quality.You can tell, the moment you step onto the high-gloss ceramic floor tiles that grace the entrance, kitchen and other wet areas, and reflect light throughout the house. You can also see it in the quality of fittings and surfaces.With multiple living areas, thereâ??s plenty of space for a family, but the low-maintenance features of the property also make it appropriate for retirees and homebuyers who may have thought a townhouse was their only option.The open-plan kitchen, meals and living space really shines. With cupboards finished in gloss white, including a large corner pantry, the kitchen also has s/s DW gas hot plates and electric oven, granite-look benchtops and internal access to the double-car garage. Thereâ??s plenty of room for a dining setting as well as a dedicated lounge area. The main bedroom continues the quality theme, with a large walk-in wardrobe and superb en suite with all the trimmings, including a double basin. Bedrooms two and three each have built-in wardrobes and thereâ??s also a study nook off the hallway that makes wonderful use of the available space.The property is perfectly set up for outdoor living, with glass doors leading from the meals area to the undercover entertaining area. The garden is combination of lush lawn and tiered garden beds behind timber retaining walls. Thereâ??s gated access at both sides of the house, 2000 litres of rainwater storage, and a Colorbond workshop (approx 4m x 4m) a concrete floor.Close to schools and the Bendigo Creek Linear Park, the location just adds to the many features of this outstanding home. Contact Sally Sheahan (03) 5445 0044

Description:
Explore The Potential
Set on approximately 1000SQM, this classic home has exciting renovation, extension or redevelopment potential (all subject to council approval). Offering 3 generous bedrooms share a common bathroom, with a spacious lounge and functional kitchen (with meals area) offering further comfort. A little effort and plenty of paint will do wonders for the timeless interior. The large front and back yards have landscaping potential, although a savvy developer will see the reward in investigating the prospect for a unit development here (subject to council approval). Moments from White Hills shopping strip, local schools, public transport and a short distance to Lake Weeroona and all it has to offer, this a fantastic opportunity not to be missed!
Dale Boyd : 0419 382 053

Description:
Everything You Could Wish For!
Behind the neat and formal exterior of this lovely home, you'll find a breath taking, expansive interior. The layout of this home is such that it offers a unique and exciting way to live. Step into a wide entrance hall and have your breath taken away. To the left is a generous size office or reception room and to the right an intimate sitting room with a gas log fireplace. Walking further into the house and the main bedroom alone, will convince prospective buyers that this is the home they have to have. The bedroom's huge en suite and spa bath will make going away for the weekend a poor choice indeed. But the loveliest feature of the bedroom is the private, enclosed patio which leads off it, an ideal place for parents to retreat to and enjoy the beautiful spring air. Further into the house the open living room is divided into dining and living spaces where the family can watch TV together, eat or simply retreat. The kitchen is beautifully appointed with a walk-in pantry, oven and five burner gas top. There is also a built-in microwave oven and dishwasher. The house has ducted heating and cooling throughout. The three bedrooms at the other end of the house have built- in robes, a beautifully appointed bathroom and second toilet. The real sale clincher at this end of the house is the theatrette wired and set up for showing movies. The covered, paved entertainment area features an overhead fan for those hot days and the newly landscaped garden is low maintenance. At the back of the house, the wired shed has a concrete floor. A double garage can be accessed from the house interior. This truly luxurious home of approx 40 squares, including garage, is a five minute walk from Lake Weeroona and won't be on the market for long.

Description:
Immaculately Presented - Close to the Action!
Investors and first home owners will see great value in this property both for its position and presentation. An imposing tubluar and rendered fence sets the scene at the immaculate triple-fronted weatherboard home. The three-bedroom home has an updated, open-plan kitchen with snow-white cupboards surround a Whirlpool electric oven, gas cooktop, Westinghouse dishwasher and a wide breakfast bar, on the other side of which is a meals area. Through an archway, the family sized lounge, with gas log fire, sits serene and welcoming. Three bedrooms and a renovated bathroom are along the hallway. The bedrooms are large and bright, two have built-in wardrobes and all have the original picture rails. Outside an undercover area will be popular for entertaining or just sitting and having a quiet drink as you take in the sea of cool, green grass that is in the very neat backyard. Other amenities include a single carport and garage, attractive landscaping, two rainwater tanks, a dog run and vegie garden. The location is enviable with Schools and shops all close by

Address: 115-123 St Killian Street WHITE HILLS VIC 3550
Description:
Rare Development Opportunity
There are some who will look at this home on two separate titles totalling one-and-a-half acres (6070 square metres), and see the potential for multiple units (STCA), especially given that it's a rare opportunity to develop one of the last sizeable allotments in the area; and then others who will look and see a solid, light-filled four-bedroom home with a delightful ambience surrounded by a garden enthusiastically nurtured over many years. You can't do better than a heavenly home in a saintly street and this four-bedroom home fits the bill. Open-plan living is at one end while the bedrooms and bathroom are at the other. Large windows open up the home and frame aspects of the restful garden - flowers, foliage and trees - all round. The kitchen and meals area is roomy and bright. A wide two-door pantry stocks enough supplies for a big family and the gas cooktop and one-and-a-half-ovens caters for big numbers. Sliding doors open onto a long patio. For more formal occasions the dining room is ideal and opens off a spacious lounge both of which take in those superb views. Ducted gas heating and evaporative cooling are throughout. Two of the four bedrooms have generous built-in wardrobes and all have ceiling fans. There's also a two-piece bathroom, separate toilet and laundry. Externally, apart from the magnificent garden, there is a ripper of a double garage and workshop, 10m x 12m, steel-framed and solid brick, containing a basin and toilet and featuring a concrete floor, power, light and phone connection. There is also a second, smaller steel-framed shed. Offered with vacant possession.
